basics.name: Gabriel Windlin
basics.label: Security Engineer & Low-Level Developer
basics.summary: I navigate the intersection of software engineering and cybersecurity. My focus is on building robust systems, breaking weak ones, and automating the rest. I specialize in offensive security tools, network reconnaissance, and low-level socket programming.

work.name: Freelance / Projects
work.summary: Developing automated penetration testing frameworks and network analysis tools.
highlights: Built a modular security suite for automated reconnaissance.
Implemented raw socket protocols in C for high-performance networking.

projects.description: A comprehensive security framework for automated penetration testing.

Includes password cracking, port scanning, and service enumeration.
Written in Python with a focus on speed and extensibility.

projects.name: TCP Chat Server
projects.description: Bare-metal implementation of a threaded TCP chat server in C.
highlights: Manual memory management and raw socket handling.
Supports multiple concurrent clients via POSIX threads.
Demonstrates deep understanding of the TCP/IP stack.
